title: Google makes its Gemini chatbot faster and more widely available
content:
In its bid to maintain pace with generative AI rivals like Anthropic and OpenAI, Google is rolling out updates to the no-fee tier of Gemini, its AI-powered chatbot. The updates are focused on making the platform more performant — and more widely available. Starting Thursday, Gemini 1.5 Flash — a lightweight multimodal model Google announced […]

title: TechCrunch Minute: Meta’s new ‘Imagine me’ feature lets you generate AI selfies
content:
Meta’s AI integrations into apps like Instagram and Facebook have felt pretty useless so far. If I’m just trying to find my friend’s Instagram, why do I have to navigate around a Meta AI interface that is desperately trying to tell me the top five vegetarian protein sources? title: Substack writers can now draft and publish posts in iOS app
content:
Substack is rolling out the ability for writers to draft and publish new posts directly from their phone via its iOS app, the company announced on Thursday. Until now, users have only been read content through the app. With this update, Substack is catching up with Medium and WordPress’ mobile apps, both of which allow […]

title: ZoomInfo alum raises $15M for startup that builds AI sales engineers
content:
Until a year ago, Arjun Pillai had the comfortable yet important role of chief data officer at ZoomInfo, a B2B database company. But the serial entrepreneur was getting antsy. He had already founded and sold two startups, including Insent, which ZoomInfo bought in 2021. “Once you start a startup, you always have that bug,” he […]

title: Endeavor CEO says long-term capital needs to be prioritized in emerging ecosystems
content:
Venture capital has become a more global industry as the tech sector slowly decentralizes. In 2022, more than 50% of VC deployed globally was invested in startups outside the U.S., according to data available from the National Science Foundation (NSF) — a stark contrast to 20 years ago, when nearly 80% of the world’s venture […]

title: Singaporean e-commerce firm Qoo10’s Korean units face probe due to payment delays to merchants
content:

On Thursday, South Korea’s Fair Trade Commission announced that it had launched an investigation into two major South Korean e-commerce platforms owned by Qoo10—Ticketmonster (TMON) and WeMakePrice—for failing to pay out […]

title: Kodiak Robotics is taking self-driving trucks off road to reach profitability faster
content:

title: Lodestar’s robotic arm will be an orbital ‘first responder’ for satellites in need
content:
Satellites are among our most critical infrastructure, providing everything from GPS to disaster coordination, yet their inherent inaccessibility leaves them vulnerable to relatively simple technical issues or attacks. London-based Lodestar is looking to change that with a “first responder” service in space using advanced robotic sentries.  Unlike some of its competitors who are also developing […]

title: Intron Health gets backing for its speech recognition tool that recognizes African accents
content:
Voice recognition is getting integrated in nearly all facets of modern living, but there remains a big gap: speakers of minority languages and those with thick accents or speech disorders like stuttering, are typically less able to use speech recognition tools that control applications, transcribe or automate tasks, among other functions. Tobi Olatunji, founder and […]
